messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: I used to work a normal five-day week. After my time off for having a baby, I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children before they go to school. I talked with my boss, and we agreed to reduce my work to a three-day week. Of course, this meant a big cut in my pay because I am paid for the days I work. However, I have noticed that the amount of work I have has not changed at all. I am now doing five days of work in only three days, but I'm getting paid much less for it.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. Multiple sentences are too long and complex for the B1 level. The sentence 'After my time off for having a baby, I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children before they go to school' is 25 words long. Sentences must be shorter and more direct. The text also uses the B2 word 'reduce' without explanation or replacement. This is a clear violation of the vocabulary rules.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: I used to work a normal five-day week. I had some time off after having a baby. Then, I decided I wanted more time with my children before they go to school. I talked with my boss, and we agreed to make my work week shorter. Now I only work three days a week. Of course, this also meant a big cut in my pay. I am only paid for the days I work. However, I have noticed that my amount of work has not changed at all. I am now doing five days of work in only three days. But I'm getting paid much less for it.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS. The text is a perfect example of B1 writing. It uses simple sentence structures, appropriate B1 vocabulary, and accurately reflects the original text. The simplification of concepts like 'parental leave' and 'pro-rata basis' is executed flawlessly.
